FunFactsSection.title: Fun Facts
FunFactsSection.description: Congratulations on scrolling all the way down! Here are some fun facts about me and this website.
items: This portfolio was built with Next.js 14, TypeScript, and Tailwind CSS.
I've written over 10,000 lines of code for this website.
The animations on this site are created using CSS transitions and React hooks.
I'm a huge fan of mechanical keyboards and own several with different switch types.
This website is fully responsive and works on all devices, from phones to ultrawide monitors.

HeroSection.title: Problem Solving
HeroSection.description:
Hello, I'm Jiin Seok, a frontend developer who has solved many problems
thanks to the freedom created by structuring, standardization, and automation,
and wants to convey this value to all users.

I want to work together to provide efficiency for customer pain points,
ensure that it doesn't become more difficult than familiar manual work,
and create a reliable and understandable frontend.
summary: Problem solving through structuring, standardization, and automation
HeroSection.code-question: What problems have you solved with TypeScript and Next.js?
HeroSection.code-answer:
I've improved user experience and development productivity
through type safety and server-side rendering.
HeroSection.seo-description:
I implement SEO best practices to ensure your website
ranks well in search engines and reaches
your target audience effectively.
HeroSection.demo-description:
Check out this interactive demo showcasing
the smooth user experience and responsive design
of my projects.

motivation-fit.title: My Professional Fit
motivation-fit.subtitle: What I excel at and what motivates me in my professional journey
motivation-fit.strength-1-description: I excel at solving complex problems by creating well-structured, standardized, and automated solutions that bring efficiency to development workflows.
motivation-fit.strength-2-description: I'm skilled at translating user pain points into intuitive interfaces that prioritize usability and accessibility.
motivation-fit.strength-3-description: I can effectively communicate technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders, bridging the gap between development and business needs.
motivation-fit.motivation-1-description: I'm motivated by seeing how my work directly improves user experiences and solves real problems for people.
motivation-fit.motivation-2-description: I thrive in environments that challenge me to learn new technologies and approaches to stay at the forefront of frontend development.
motivation-fit.motivation-3-description: I find fulfillment in working with diverse teams to create innovative solutions that wouldn't be possible individually.
motivation-fit.conclusion-description: My combination of technical skills and intrinsic motivations allows me to create sustainable value for companies that prioritize both user experience and developer efficiency.

personal.title: About Me
personal.subtitle: Get to know me better, both professionally and personally
personal.about-description: I'm Jiin Seok, a frontend developer with a knack for uncovering problems and weaving them into clean & magical solutions. I used to be a QA engineer, and I still obsess over seamless user experiences! I bring a unique perspective to every project I work on, combining my technical skills with a deep understanding of user needs.
personal.interest-1: JetBrains tools - I'm a fan of WebStorm and other JetBrains products
personal.interest-2: Mechanical keyboards - I love tactile switches and great plugins
personal.interest-3: Frontend technologies - Always exploring TypeScript, React, and Next.js
personal.value-1: Clean Code - I believe in creating solutions that are both functional and elegant
personal.value-2: User Experience - I'm obsessed with creating seamless and intuitive interfaces
personal.value-3: Continuous Learning - I'm always diving into new concepts like HTTP and accessibility
personal.quote: Excited to connect and craft clean & magical experiences together!

til.title: Today I Learned
til.description: A technical blog where I organize what I've learned during frontend development.
til.a1: Next.js makes React application development more convenient by providing various features such as server-side rendering (SSR), static site generation (SSG), file-based routing, API routes, and image optimization.
til.a2: TypeScript improves code stability through a static type system and helps detect errors during development. It also enhances development productivity through IDE auto-completion features and helps with code documentation.
til.a3: React Query was created to solve the complexity of server state management. It simplifies API call-related state management by providing features such as caching, background updates, and data synchronization.
til.q4: How do Type and Interface differ?
til.a4: Type and Interface are two ways to define types in TypeScript. Interface is good for extensibility and allows declaration merging, while Type allows for more diverse type expressions such as union types and intersection types.
til.q5: When and how should you specify types for useState?
til.a5: You should explicitly specify types for useState using generics when type inference from the initial value is not sufficient. This is particularly useful for states that include null or undefined, or complex object types.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.description: Common questions about frontend development and my work.

career_path.title: Why a Frontend Developer?
career_path.description: My journey took me from aspiring to study philosophy, to entering theology, double majoring in library and information science, managing data, working in CX, QA, and finally becoming a frontend developer. This path was driven by my passion for people and logic. This journey has led to my current ability to develop intuitive and efficient frontend solutions based on a deep understanding of user interfaces and experiences. Frontend development, where I can solve problems with technology at the closest point to users, is the field where I can best express my passion and capabilities.

faq.q1: What frontend technologies do you specialize in?
faq.a1: I specialize in modern frontend technologies including React, TypeScript, Next.js, and various CSS frameworks. I focus on creating responsive, accessible, and performant user interfaces.
faq.q2: How do you approach responsive design?
faq.a2: I use a mobile-first approach with CSS frameworks like Tailwind CSS. I ensure that interfaces work well on all device sizes by using responsive design principles, flexible layouts, and thorough testing.
faq.q3: Do you have experience with state management?
faq.a3: Yes, I have extensive experience with various state management solutions including React Context API, Redux, Zustand, and React Query for server state. I choose the appropriate solution based on project requirements.
faq.q4: How do you ensure code quality?
faq.a4: I maintain code quality through comprehensive testing (unit, integration, and E2E), code reviews, static type checking with TypeScript, linting, and following best practices for performance and accessibility.
faq.q5: Can you work with design systems?
faq.a5: Yes, I have experience implementing and maintaining design systems. I understand the importance of consistent UI components and can work with designers to translate their vision into reusable code components.
